      Allows a user to invite people to favorite an offer location This will generate an invite token, which when used, will give the invitee the offer location in their favorite's list.

      Target API Endpoint: /invite/offerLocation

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      the account ID of the user making the share SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
      the application key SirqulKeys.offerLocationId
      the offer location to share

      InviteResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response

    • Method Detail

      • acceptInvite

        public void acceptInvite(Map<String,Object> params,
                ISirqulCallback<ConsumerInviteResponse> callback)
        Allows a user to accept an invite. The user will also become the inviter's friend.

        Target API Endpoint: /invite/accept

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the accountId of the user who is accepting the invite
        • SirqulKeys.token
          the invite token

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ConsumerInviteResponse on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response with message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        InviteApiBase.acceptInvite

      • getInvite

        public void getInvite(Map<String,Object> params,
             ISirqulCallback<ConsumerInviteResponse> callback)
        This is used to determine whether an invite token is valid. If the token is valid, this will also return information about who invited the user, and what they are invited to.

        Target API Endpoint: /invite/get

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.token
          the invite token

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a ConsumerInviteResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        InviteApiBase.getInvite

      • getInviteUrlForAlbum

        public void getInviteUrlForAlbum(Map<String,Object> params,
                        ISirqulCallback<InviteResponse> callback)
        Allows a user to invite people to gain access to an album. This will generate an invite token, which when used, will give the invitee access to an album (whether it is private or not). The invitee will also become the user's friend when the invitation is accepted.

        Target API Endpoint: /invite/album

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.albumId
          the album id or the album to share
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a InviteResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        InviteApiBase.getInviteUrlForAlbum

      • getInviteUrlForAlbumContest

        public void getInviteUrlForAlbumContest(Map<String,Object> params,
                               ISirqulCallback<InviteResponse> callback)
        Allows a user to invite people to gain access to an album contest. This will generate an invite token, which when used, will give the invitee access to an album contest (whether it is private or not). The invitee will also become the user's friend when the invitation is accepted.

        Target API Endpoint: /invite/albumContest

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key
        • SirqulKeys.albumContestId
          the album contest to share
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a InviteResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        InviteApiBase.getInviteUrlForAlbumContest

      • getInviteUrlForGameLevel

        public void getInviteUrlForGameLevel(Map<String,Object> params,
                            ISirqulCallback<InviteResponse> callback)
        Allows a user to invite people to play their custom game level. This will generate an invite token, which when used, will give the invitee access to play the game level (whether it is private or not). The invitee will also become the user's friend when the invitation is accepted.

        Target API Endpoint: /invite/gameLevel

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key
        • SirqulKeys.gameLevelId
          the game level that the user owns and is giving access to
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a InviteResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        InviteApiBase.getInviteUrlForGameLevel

      • getInviteUrlForMission

        public void getInviteUrlForMission(Map<String,Object> params,
                          ISirqulCallback<InviteResponse> callback)
        Allows a user to invite people to complete a mission. This will generate an invite token, which when used, will give the invitee access to complete a mission (whether it is private or not). The invitee will also become the user's friend when the invitation is accepted.

        Target API Endpoint: /invite/mission

        Available parameters for this api

          the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key
        • SirqulKeys.missionId
          the mission to share
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the current location of the user

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a InviteResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods.
